text: Johannes Joseph "Jon" van Rood (7 April 1926 â€“ 21 July 2017) was a Dutch immunologist. He founded Eurotransplant in 1967,History , Eurotransplant. Retrieved on 29 Juli 2017. a non-profit organization responsible for encouraging and coordinating organ transplants. He was born in Scheveningen, the Netherlands. In 1977 van Rood was awarded the Robert Koch Prize. In 1978, he was awarded the Wolf Prize in Medicine, jointly with George D. Snell and Jean Dausset. van Rood became member of the Royal Netherlands Academy of Arts and Sciences in 1978. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. Van Rood died on 21 July 2017 in Leeuwarden, the Netherlands at the age of 91. ==References== ==Other websites== * Profile at KNAW Category:1926 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Dutch academics Category:Dutch physicians Category:People from The Hague Category:Wolf Prize winners Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Jon van Rood
